data.title: Valarie Allman, Olympic Athlete From Austin, Texas, To Celebrate Gold Medal In Style
data.meta_description: The Olympics are a showing of the greatest athletes in the world. One from Austin is going to celebrate her gold medal in a very Texan way.
data.text:
Texas is currently very well represented in the 2024 Olympics.

In fact, the medal count so far reveals that if Texas was it's own representative in the event, they'd have more medals than other countries! So what does that say about the Lone Star State? Well the Olympics certainly a Texas flair to it for the United State as a whole.

So when an American wins a Gold, Silver, or Bronze medal, it's cause to celebrate. Even more if they're representing to the great state of Texas. One athlete who's recently made the news is none other than Valarie Allman from Austin, Texas.

Of course, she brought another Gold medal to this wonderful state. But how she's going to celebrate the accomplishment is truly the Texan way.

Valarie Allman Set To Memorialize Gold Medal With A Texas Food Classic

Allman's performance, which you can see here, resulted in her second straight gold medal in the discus event. She also talked to NBC Sports about the moment when took the top spot as well. But how she is going to toast to her moment is what many Texans will all agree that is the best way to do so.

According to KXAN, Allman will be going to Terry Black's in Austin, and to quote her directly: "celebrate and eat a pound of brisket...I canâ€™t wait to go all out there."

As it turns out, Terry Black's is ready for her appearance:

Congrats Valarie! Eat all the brisket you want, you've earned it!
